title: Bug 120922: Improve 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor
description: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. When prompted with the message 'Do you want to save the changes?' (including the quotes), selecting 'Yes' will save the changes, 'No' will discard the changes, and 'Cancel' will do nothing and remain on the Source page. In addition, the dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user has to figure out how to save the changes or discard them, and the error message is not clear.
EB: The XML Report Design has been modified. The dialog should use a better title (without the quotes).
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the 'Source page is dirty' error message.
